notes: Our home is solar-powered. The guesthouse has fans but no air conditioning. The room is cleaned between every visit, but nothing is new. If you expect new and shiny, this place is not for you. The price varies from season to season and from day to day based upon availability and demand.  We do discount the price if the room remains unbooked, so there are some great last day deals. The price you pay is what Airbnb says you will pay AFTER you have correctly identified the dates, the number of guests and pets.  The price for a one-night stay is never less than $50 because $40 is our cleaning fee and the nightly fee is never less than $10.  Sometimes, Airbnb advertises our guesthouse without the cleaning fee.  Thus, Airbnb's advertised price can be as low as $10/night (even though the true cost for a single night's stay at this price will be $50).  We understand that this can be misleading, but we don't control how Airbnb advertises prices.

host_about:
We love living in Venice. It epitomizes everything we love about life. The ocean, art, access to great restaurants, and scenic walks, and the diverse culture.

We throughly enjoy having guests, and feel that everyone we meet has a way of enriching our lives. Meeting someone new and hearing their story can be just as entertaining and interesting as watching a great movie.

The restaurants in our neighborhood are amazing. We can find just about any type of food we are in the mood for. Some of our favorites are Thai, Italian, Mexican, and Japanese. All within close walking distance.

Most of our regular places to visit are not very far away. We appreciate a sunset walk to the Venice Pier, a bike ride to the Santa Monica Pier,  a hike in the Santa Monica Mountains or in Joshua Tree National Park, staying at BnB's in Ventura and Santa Barbara, and camping at Big Sur and the Giant Forest.

There is lots of free fun to be had in and around Venice. Here's a list  of the local events that we love to partake in, and often invite a group of our friends to join us; concerts on the Santa Monica Pier, the Abbot Kinney Festival, The Venice Canal Holiday Boat Parade, The Venice Carnival, The Festival of the Chariots, The Marina Boat Parade, The Marina 4th of July Fireworks and Concerts in Burton Chase Park.

host_about:
We're Johnny and Mark, a super-fun, committed (25 years and counting) and married gay couple in our 50s. We live on Ballona Creek in Del Rey, 3.5 miles from the gorgeous Pacific Ocean. We share our beautifully and recently renovated home with our hilarious and well-behaved dogs Wolfgang and Hedwig (we hope you love dogs) and you're welcome to join us on one of our daily local hikes. We're right on the famous Ballona Creek Bike Path; you can grab one of our beach cruiser bikes and head out to the beach at Playa Del Rey or to the Marina, Venice, Santa Monica and Manhattan Beach.

We have 2 beautiful guest rooms, one with a queen-sized bed, the other with a double bed. We can sleep 4 comfortably and if you're more we can figure something out. Both rooms share a private bath and have premium streaming cable TV with HBO, Showtime, Epix, Cinemax, Netflix, Amazon and super-fast wifi. 

We're a non-smoking vegan household, but smoking is OK outside and non-vegan food items are OK too. We may be vegan but don't worry: we're tolerant, non-judgy and non-preachy vegans.

Explore Los Angeles (you'll always do best if you rent a car and have GPS capability) and let us insiders point you toward some of our favorite places such as Marilyn Monroe's crypt, the best views of the Hollywood sign, the stores where the studios sell their wardrobe collections, plus other places only real Angelinos know. We love our city and want you to live with us as a local, and that means if you're around there'll be drinkies on cocktail nights (Mark makes a mean vodka martini!). Of course, breakfast is always included.

My name is Carlos Roberto Sanchez-Rosas, my friends call me "Sano" (It means healthy in Spanish)  I have been a host in the Airbnb community for 5 years. It has been amazing and highly rewarding with great memories and awesome new friends. 

"Mi Casa es tu Casa" is a Spanish saying that means: "My House is Yours" and l mean this literally when I open the doors to my Airbnb guests. My ultimate goal is for them to feel right at home. 

Sigmund Freud stated, "The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind." And because in LA is the sunny place where we are all kings, I aim to give every single guest at Casa de Carlos the royal treatment when they choose to stay here.  

I always take joy and satisfaction been a host. I believe we have become ambassadors because we proudly introduce visitors to our beloved city. I wholeheartedly believe that is great public service. There are lots of ways we are contributing to the sharing economy and it is a really good fit with who we are as Angelenos. Our ultimate goal is to turn every visitor encounter into a positive, memorable experience.

We are looking forward to meet you.

Your hosts truly,
Carlos and Mr. Donn Boerman.

host_about:
We love living in Venice. It epitomizes everything we love about life. The ocean, art, access to great restaurants, and scenic walks, and the diverse culture.

We throughly enjoy having guests, and feel that everyone we meet has a way of enriching our lives. Meeting someone new and hearing their story can be just as entertaining and interesting as watching a great movie.

The restaurants in our neighborhood are amazing. We can find just about any type of food we are in the mood for. Some of our favorites are Thai, Italian, Mexican, and Japanese. All within close walking distance.

Most of our regular places to visit are not very far away. We appreciate a sunset walk to the Venice Pier, a bike ride to the Santa Monica Pier,  a hike in the Santa Monica Mountains or in Joshua Tree National Park, staying at BnB's in Ventura and Santa Barbara, and camping at Big Sur and the Giant Forest.

There is lots of free fun to be had in and around Venice. Here's a list  of the local events that we love to partake in, and often invite a group of our friends to join us; concerts on the Santa Monica Pier, the Abbot Kinney Festival, The Venice Canal Holiday Boat Parade, The Venice Carnival, The Festival of the Chariots, The Marina Boat Parade, The Marina 4th of July Fireworks and Concerts in Burton Chase Park.

How blessed we are to live in Venice. Hope you enjoy your visit as much we do living here.

Wherever you stay we hope you thoroughly enjoy your visit to this wonderful place we call home!
